Content:: Kenneth Stanley Bochen (November 26, 1938 – November 18, 1999) was a Canadian football player who played for the Winnipeg Blue Bombers. He won the Grey Cup with them in 1959.[1] After his football career, he worked for Molson Breweries. He died in 1999.[2]  This biographical article relating to Canadian football is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
